(% style="text-align:center" %) == __**Using ROS on a RasperryPi for Image Transport with Simulink as development tool**__ ==
----
Notes:
* //To be abled to use this Tutorial you need to have the “MATLAB-” and “SIMULINK Support Package for Raspberry Pi” installed. You also need the official “Robotics System Toolbox” from MATLAB/SIMULINK.// * //Use a Raspberrypi 3 B v1.2 or an earlier Version to set up the Raspberry with the “MATLAB/SIMULINK Support Package for Raspberry Pi”, otherwise you will receive a network Error due to incompatibility. (State of 09/2018) // * //It’s helpful to execute the following Tutorials beforehand: (link) (link)//
----
== **Introduction** ==
We want to stream an RGB-image from a ROS-node on a RaspberryPi to another ROS-node on a virtual machine. To work with MATLAB/SIMULINK on a RaspberryPi we need to set up the RaspberryPi with a modified Linux distribution which is provided by the Simulink Support Package for Raspberri Pi. This Tutorial assumes you understand the Basics of ROS and ROS in MATLAB/SIMULINK. We base our model on the following MATLAB/SIMULINK example: (Link)
----
=== **Setup your Raspberry:** ===
----
**Install Linux on your Raspberry**
* Install the "Simulink Support Package for Raspberry Pi"
* Open Matlab and click on the “Add-Ons”-button>>”Manage Add-Ons”.
* Search for “Simulink Support Package for Raspberry Pi”-tab in the list.
* Click on the “Setup”-button on the right-hand side of the tab.(A small gear wheel)
* Chose the Version of the Raspberry Pi you use and click “Next”.
* Chose “Setup Hardware with MathWorks Raspbian Image” and follow the instructions.
* After the Setup when you start the Raspberry Pi for the first time execute the command:
>{{html}}<font size="2">sudo raspi-config</font>{{/html}}
* Navigate to change hostname and change your keyboard setting and the default Hostname to a distinct one by executing:
>{{html}}<font size="2">sudo grep -lr "{ALTER_NAME}" /etc/*</font>{{/html}}
This is to make sure the old Hostname doesn’t appear in any systemic file.
* Restart the RaspberryPi.
----
**Install ROS on your RaspberryPi**
After you've installed the Operation System of your Raspberry follow the instructions of the Install_ROS Tutorial.
----
**Set up a connection from MATLAB/SIMULINK to your Raspberry Pi:**
To set up a connection between your Raspberry Pi and MATLAB you need to know the Hostname or the IP-Address of your Raspberry Pi.
When your Raspberry Pi is connected to your machine and running open MATLAB and execute the command:
>{{html}}<font size="2">rpi=raspberrypi(‘{RPi_IP}’);</font>{{/html}}
(replace rpi with a variable-identifier of your choice)
No you have an object which represents your RaspberryPi holding its IP and other information. If you execute the command:
>{{html}}<font size="2">openShell(RaspiObj)</font>{{/html}}
You can execute commands on your Raspberry from your platform using Matlab from this Shell.
